body:
Hi Nassif,

the most important thing is, that you KNOW what is your type of lens you
are using. Then you have to "transfer" its specification into correct
radiance view parameters.
what you need is view type, horizontal and vertical size of the image.

If you look at the documentation of evalglare you can see, that you can
specify the view type when calling evalglare (you don't have to add the
view spec to the HDR file):

/In case, the view settings within the image are missing or are not
valid (e.g. after the use of pcompos or pcomb), the view options can be
set by command line options. As soon as view options are set within the
command line, view options within the image are ignored. The view
options are implemented according to the RADIANCE definition (please
read man page of rpict for details)://
//-vtt Set view type to t. (for fish-eye views, please use --vta or
--vth preferably)//
//-vf viewfile Get view parameters from file.//
//-vv val Set the view vertical size to val.//
//-vh val Set the view horizontal size to val.//
/
And be sure using the latest version of evalglare (1.11).

Good luck!

Jan
